# Basic  

## Blockquotes 

Blockquotes are written after `>`, e.g.,

```markdown
> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. 
> Quisque in sodales dolor, non suscipit leo. 
> Proin id massa quis libero tincidunt gravida. 
> Mauris sollicitudin eleifend dignissim. 
> Etiam id urna sit amet mauris rutrum luctus. 
```

The actual output (with the custom style) will look like:

> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. 
> Quisque in sodales dolor, non suscipit leo. 
> Proin id massa quis libero tincidunt gravida. 
> Mauris sollicitudin eleifend dignissim. 
> Etiam id urna sit amet mauris rutrum luctus. 


# Tables 



```{r}
tbl <- 
  dplyr::tribble(
    ~groupname, ~rowname, ~participants,
    "Asia-Pacific",        "Asia (excluding Middle and Near East)",      76,   
    "Asia-Pacific",        "Oceania",      26,   
    "Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)",        "Africa",      6,  
    "Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)",        "Europe and Near East",      136,  
    "Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)",        "Middle East",      21,  
    "The Americas",        "Canada",      35,
    "The Americas",        "Latin America and Caribbean",      17,
    "The Americas",        "United States",      503,
  )

gt(tbl) %>% 
  summary_rows(
    columns = vars(participants),
    fns = "sum"
  ) %>% 
  tab_footnote(
    footnote = "Excluding Puerto Rico, which is included in the Caribbean numbers",
    locations = cells_stub(
      rows = "United States"
    )
  ) %>% 
  tab_options(
    footnote.glyph = "*", table.width = pct(100)
  )  
```

# Snippets 

[Snippets](https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/204463668-Code-Snippets) are text macros used for quickly inserting common code or prose. To insert a snippet into an R Markdown documents you will need to type the whole character sequence for the snippet and press **Shift+Tab**. The following are a list of the available snippets and their function:

* [`main_aside`](#main-and-aside): Creates a sections split by content in the main body and also content in a sidebar. Replace `section_header` with the name of the section being created.  

* [`cols_2`](#two-column-layout): Creates a two column element 

* [`cols_3`](#three-column-layout):  Creates a 3 column element

# Main and Aside

<div id="main">
<h1>My Section Header</h1>

Main content goes here...

</div>
<div id="aside" class="aside">

Sidebar content goes here...

Useful for inserting small images or notes.

```{r}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth()
```

</div>
